info.title: SaaS API
info.description: This spec details the APIs that enable partners to sell their SaaS applications in the AppSource marketplace and the Azure Marketplace. These APIs are a requirement for transactable SaaS offers on the AppSource and Azure Marketplace.

post.description: The resolve endpoint enables the publisher to resolve a marketplace token to a persistent resource ID. The resource ID is the unique identifier for a SaaS subscription. When a user is redirected to a partner's website, the URL contains a token in the query parameters. The partner is expected to use this token and make a request to resolve it. The response contains the unique SaaS subscription ID, name, offer ID, and plan for the resource. This token is valid for one hour only.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API.

parameters.name: x-ms-requestid
parameters.description: A unique string value for tracking the request from the client, preferably a GUID. If this value isn't provided, one will be generated and provided in the response headers.

parameters.name: x-ms-correlationid
parameters.description: A unique string value for operation on the client. This parameter correlates all events from client operation with events on the server side. If this value isn't provided, one will be generated and provided in the response headers.

parameters.name: x-ms-marketplace-token
parameters.description: The token query parameter in the URL when the user is redirected to the SaaS partner's website from Azure (for example,  https://contoso.com/signup?token=..). Note, The URL decodes the token value from the browser before using it.

200.description: OK. Describes the SaaS subscription indicated by the x-ms-marketplace-token.

400.description: Bad request. x-ms-marketplace-token is missing, malformed, or expired.

403.description: Unauthorized. The authentication token was not provided or is invalid, or the request is attempting to access an acquisition that does not belong to the current publisher.

get.description: Lists all the SaaS subscriptions for a publisher.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API.

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: Optional value, only used for ListSubscriptions.

parameters.name: x-ms-requestid
parameters.description: A unique string value for tracking the request from the client, preferably a GUID. If this value isn't provided, one will be generated and provided in the response headers.

parameters.name: x-ms-correlationid
parameters.description: A unique string value for operation on the client. This parameter correlates all events from client operation with events on the server side. If this value isn't provided, one will be generated and provided in the response headers.

200.description: OK. Gets the publisher and corresponding subscriptions for all the publisher's offers, based on the authentication token.

403.description: Unauthorized. The authentication token was not provided or is invalid, or the request is attempting to access an acquisition that does not belong to the current publisher.

get.description: Gets the specified SaaS subscription. Use this call to get license information and plan information.

parameters.name: api-version

parameters.name: x-ms-requestid

200.description: OK. Gets the SaaS subscription from identifier.

403.description: Unauthorized. The authentication token was not provided or is invalid, or the request is attempting to access an acquisition that does not belong to the current publisher.

patch.description: Use this call to update the plan, the user count (quantity), or both.

403.description: Unauthorized. The authentication token was not provided or is invalid, or the request is attempting to access an acquisition that does not belong to the current publisher.

patch.summary: Update the status of an operation
patch.description: Update the status of an operation to indicate success or failure with the provided values.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API.

parameters.name: x-ms-requestid
parameters.description: A unique string value for tracking the request from the client, preferably a GUID. If this value isn't provided, one will be generated and provided in the response headers.

200.description: A call to inform of completion of an operation on the partner side. For example, this response could signal the change of seats or plans.

403.description: Unauthorized. The authentication token was not provided or is invalid, or the request is attempting to access an acquisition that does not belong to the current publisher.

409.description: Conflict. For example, a newer transaction is already fulfilled.

ApiVersion.description: The request must send the following parameters as a URL Encoded form; grant_type - client_credentials; resource - 62d94f6c-d599-489b-a797-3e10e42fbe22; client_id - AAD Registered App Client ID; client_secret - AAD Registered App Client Secret

@nextLink.description: Link to get the next set of subscriptions.

saasSubscriptionStatus.description: Indicates the status of the operation.

isTest.description: Indicating whether the current subscription is a test asset.

isFreeTrial.description: true - the customer subscription is currently in free trial, false - the customer subscription is not currently in free trial.(optional field - default false)

sessionMode.description: Dry Run indicates all transactions run as Test-Mode in the commerce stack

sandboxType.description: Possible Values are None, Csp (Csp sandbox purchase)
